snippet: Comments by a Syrian exile opposition leader were made to feed fears of a rebel government, a defense expert said.
abstract: Public relations controversy erupts after leading Israeli newspaper publishes comments from  interview with Sheik Ahmad Moaz al-Khatib, leader of Syria's main exile opposition group; Syrian government falsely characterizes Sheik Khatib's remarks to feed fears of rebel government.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Comments by a Syrian exile opposition leader were made to feed fears of a rebel government, a defense expert said.

headline.seo: Israeli Says Syria Twisted Comments by Rebel Supporter
headline.main: Israeli Says Syrian Media Misreported Exile’s Views
headline.print_headline: Israeli Says Syrian Media Misreported Exile’s Views

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
